snippet: Illinois would become the last state to supersede local ordinances and allow the public possession of concealed firearms with a bill approved Friday by the state legislature.
abstract: Illinois will become last state to allow public possession of concealed firearms with bill approved by state legislature; Gov Pat Quinn has not indicated whether he will sign bill.
lead_paragraph: Illinois would become the last state to supersede local ordinances and allow the public possession of concealed firearms with a bill approved Friday by the state legislature.
